column2: Nawal El Saadawi is the most translated Arab woman.
Assia Djebar's books are actually written in French but I have chosen to include them in this database because they are important pieces to looking at books written by women from North Africa.
column3: She is one of the "immortels" of the academie francaise.

column2: This book is one of only two books translated by Fadwa Tuqan.
This book has gone through 6 reprints.
First book by Hanan El Shaykh translated, she will go on to become one of the most translated women authors from the Arab world with mora than 6 books appearing in this database.

This decade is characterized by a depth of translation, as opposode to breadth. Very specific Arab women are being translated over and over again (Hanan Al Shaykh, Nawal El Saadawi,Leila Abouzeid, Salwa Bakr)
The novel is set in the lebanese civil war and translated 7 years after the war ended and 13 years after it was originally published.
Leila Abou Zeid translated Malcolm X's autobiohraphy into arabic and read it on the radio
All of Tahawi's novels have been translated into englished. All of the translations have been published by AUC press.
This novel is one of the most read ones in the Arab world and North Africa. Its sequels were never translated.

Tillers of water was the winner of the Naguiba Mahfouz Medal for Literature. The award is giving to a modern Arabic novel that has not been translated to English. The novel is then translated and publisher by AUC press.
